lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Siri.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Siri.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* get command from the keyword input
* @param keyword keyword that the user input
* @return the command associated with the keyword
Prints a greeting message from Siri to the console.
System.out.print(" Hello! I'm Siri\n" + " What can I do for you?\n");
Prints an exit message from Siri to the console.
System.out.print(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!\n");
* Prints back the given word to the console as an echo message.
* @param word the input string to be echoed

throw new SiriException("Task does not exist");

throw new SiriException("Task does not exist");
System.out.print("  OK, I've marked this task as not done yet: \n");

System.out.print("Now you have " + taskManager.getCount() + " tasks in the list.\n");

throw new SiriException("Task does not exist");
System.out.print("Now you have " + taskManager.getCount() + " tasks in the list.\n");
* Returns the string representation of this deadline task,
* including its type marker "[D]", completion status,

*

If the task is marked as done, "[X]" is shown;

public EventTask(String description, String from, String to) {

* including its type marker "[E]", completion status,

*

If the task is marked as done, "[X]" is shown;

//unrecognised comment will treat as adding new general task
throw new SiriException("Todo task description is empty", "todo <description>", argument);
throw new SiriException("Missing '/' separator for deadline task", "deadline <description> / <time>", argument);
throw new SiriException("Deadline description or date is empty", "deadline <description> / <time>", argument);
throw new SiriException("Missing '/' separator for event task", "event <description> / <start> / <end>", argument);
throw new SiriException("Event description, start, or end is empty", "event <description> / <start> / <end>", argument);
EventTask event = new EventTask(description, from, to);
